(A play on the classic question "Why did the chicken cross the road?" with a French twist)', '"I\'m not hungry, I\'m just lacking in sustenance...on the left side of my body." (A pun on the phrase "I\'m not feeling well, I\'m just lacking in sustenance" with a focus on the left side of the body)', '"Left hungry? More like right neglected!" (A play on words, using the phrase "left hungry" and replacing it with "right neglected")', '"When in France, always eat what\'s on the left." (A humorous take on the common travel saying "When in Rome...")', '"I\'m not sure if I\'m hungry or just lacking a good baguette...on the left side of my body." (Another pun on the phrase "I\'m not feeling well" with a focus on the left side of the body and incorporating the idea of a tasty French bread)', '"The left side of my stomach is growling, but I\'m too proud to say it."
